main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified flying objects near March Air Force Base in Southern California were reported in August and September of 1952.
interesting points: The first sighting involved an oval object observed at 10,000 feet moving at high speed for 10 seconds., The second sighting described an oval-shaped object at 25,000 to 30,000 feet observed for around 20 minutes, with no sound or visible propulsion., Two Air Force airmen were the witnesses during the second sighting, observing the object while watching the sky., A third sighting involved an object shaped like a football, moving faster than any known aircraft and disappearing upon leaving sunlight., Reports indicated clear weather conditions during the sightings with no vapor trails left by the objects.
witness description: Air Force airmen and support personnel
